projectInfo.name: jruby
projectInfo.credits: This report contains data retrieved from the National Vulnerability Database: http://nvd.nist.gov

vulnerability.name: CVE-2012-5370
vulnerability.description: JRuby computes hash values without properly restricting the ability to trigger hash collisions predictably, which allows context-dependent attackers to cause a denial of service (CPU consumption) via crafted input to an application that maintains a hash table, as demonstrated by a universal multicollision attack against the MurmurHash2 algorithm, a different vulnerability than CVE-2011-4838.

vulnerability.name: CVE-2012-5370
vulnerability.description: JRuby computes hash values without properly restricting the ability to trigger hash collisions predictably, which allows context-dependent attackers to cause a denial of service (CPU consumption) via crafted input to an application that maintains a hash table, as demonstrated by a universal multicollision attack against the MurmurHash2 algorithm, a different vulnerability than CVE-2011-4838.

vulnerability.name: CVE-2011-4838
vulnerability.description: JRuby before 1.6.5.1 computes hash values without restricting the ability to trigger hash collisions predictably, which allows context-dependent attackers to cause a denial of service (CPU consumption) via crafted input to an application that maintains a hash table.

reference.name: 20111228 n.runs-SA-2011.004 - web programming languages and platforms - DoS through hash table

vulnerability.name: CVE-2010-1330
vulnerability.cwe: CWE-79 Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')
vulnerability.description: The regular expression engine in JRuby before 1.4.1, when $KCODE is set to 'u', does not properly handle characters immediately after a UTF-8 character, which allows remote attackers to conduct cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks via a crafted string.

dependency.description: Java port of Oniguruma: http://www.geocities.jp/kosako3/oniguruma that uses byte arrays directly instead of java Strings and chars

evidence.name: description
evidence.value: Byte based encoding support library for java

evidence.name: description
evidence.value: Java port of Oniguruma: http://www.geocities.jp/kosako3/oniguruma that uses byte arrays directly instead of java Strings and chars

evidence.name: description
evidence.value: A set of platform constants (e.g. errno values)

evidence.name: description
evidence.value: An abstracted interface to invoking native functions from java

evidence.name: description
evidence.value: JLine is a java library for reading and editing user input in console applications. It features tab-completion, command history, password masking, customizable keybindings, and pass-through handlers to use to chain to other console applications.

evidence.name: description
evidence.value: Lookup TCP and UDP services from java
